poem:
**The Underworld Beneath Us**

Beneath our feet, rivers whisper,  
carrying tales in chemical tongues,  
a stream of eternal twilight,  
where sludge and water mingle,  
a dance of invisible particles,  
unseen yet weaving into the fabric,  
a tapestry of questions, unstitched,  
and we stand, on this sullied soil,  
pondering the unseen threads that bind us.
